Uses of Class
fr.sii.ogham.assertion.sms.SmsAssert

  • Packages that use SmsAssert 
    Package Description
    fr.sii.ogham.assertion.sms  

    • Uses of SmsAssert in fr.sii.ogham.assertion.sms

      Methods in fr.sii.ogham.assertion.sms that return SmsAssert 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SmsAssert<P> SmsAssert.content(org.hamcrest.Matcher<String> matcher)
      Make assertions on the content of the message(s).
      SmsAssert<SmsListAssert<P>> SmsListAssert.forEach()
      Fluent API to write assertions on every received messages.
      SmsAssert<P> SmsAssert.from(org.hamcrest.Matcher<PhoneNumberInfo> matcher)
      Make assertions on the sender of the message(s) using fluent API.
      SmsAssert<SmsListAssert<P>> SmsListAssert.message(int index)
      Access a particular message to write assertions for it: .message(0).content(is("foobar")) You can use this method to chain several assertions on different messages: .message(0).content(is("foobar")) .and() .message(1).content(is("toto"))
      SmsAssert<ReceivedSmsAssert> ReceivedSmsAssert.receivedMessage(int index)
      Access fluent API to write assertions on a particular received message.
      SmsAssert<P> SmsAssert.to(org.hamcrest.Matcher<PhoneNumberInfo> matcher)
      Make assertions on the recipient of the message(s) using fluent API.

      Make assertions on the sender of the message(s) using fluent API.
      PhoneNumberAssert<SmsAssert<P>> SmsAssert.to()
      Make assertions on the recipient of the message(s) using fluent API.
